bioghist.p: Frances Adeline Taltavull (1919-2004), was a teacher and school counselor for 44 years at Thomas Potter and General George Henry Thomas Elementary schools in the Fairhill section of North Philadelphia. Her bachelor's, master's and doctoral degrees were all from Temple University.

scopecontent.p: This collection includes notes, genealogies and annotated photograph albums for the Taltavull and Kohlmeyer families. There are typed manuscripts of Frances Taltavull's novel Awake Singing and her study on the Vietnam War entitled Americans in War and Peace: Reflections on Vietnam, as well as a published copy of Our Families written for the Vacation Church School. The collection also contains a large bundle of correspondence from a minister of her acquaintance; they wrote to one another almost weekly for roughly a one year span in 1945. There is also annotated scrapbook from the retirement home, the Granite Farms Estates, where she lived for 17 years, and a journal kept sporadically between 1963 and 1971.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
